captions.text:
This is going to be sit pretty and what you
want with sit pretty is to get them to go

up on their hind quarters. With bigger dogs
this is a little bit more difficult but you

can use a wall so they don't tip over, some
dogs you can just kind of teeter totter in

to it. This is also something that's really
good to exercise your dogs core muscles so

if you have a dog that's in agility or in
any kind of sporting event you can get their

muscles and their core all warmed up. How
you would start this would basically get a

nice "sit" and then take your treat and lift
it over their head, you want to see the feet

come off the ground. You want to take them
little steps tell them "pretty" "good boy."

As they get good at it you can start getting
it a little bit further over their head and

with the big dogs they tend to tip a little
bit. "sit, good boy." Then you can add a hand

signal. A hand signal can be anything like
this "good boy" then you hold it there and

you get a "stay." If you want to take it to
the next level and get a little bit of a stretch

over it you can get a "sit pretty" and bring
them up and that gets a little bit of an exercise

title: Dog Tricks : Sitting Pretty Dog Trick

comments.text:
KIMINJECTION: Try to teach your dog no mugging, which means you hold a 
treat in front of them in your closed fist and let them lick to get it. 
Once they back away or look away, give them the treat. This will teach them 
not to try to take it unless you give it to them. However, there is one 
problem with this. Then your dog won't follow a lure because you have 
taught them not to. Teach them target. Have your hand in a fist with your 
pointer and middle fingers extended. When your dog goes to sniff

comments.text:
@hanniel04 ok well first of all (not to be rude) don't try comparing your 
dog to this one. This dog is reviewing he's clearly been taught this trick 
already which is why he does it flawlessly. I've had this same problem with 
many dogs. He's trying to build his balance. For deep chested or large dogs 
this trick can be the equivalent of doing a hand stand for us. Try standing 
behind him and have him put his back to your legs . Then support his chest 
with your hand. Keep him baited too.
comments.author: bellaxedward132

comments.text:
@bellaxedward132 she sits pretty..but then she is holding my fist with both 
her paws..how do i make her sit pretty like the dog in this video?....
comments.author: hanniel04

comments.text:
@bellaxedward132 he really doesn't care about treats :S he must not like 
them
comments.author: jonvegard31

comments.text:
@deathangel90210 this might sound harsh but try biting back or slapping 
her. That's how dogs teach each-other and that's why my dogs never even nip 
at me. Even it i'm holding a treat to their nose. - Dog trainer for the 
humane society for 6 years. Dog trainer for 8. ;)
comments.author: bellaxedward132

comments.text:
@jonvegard31 Try baiting him by keeping the treat in a fist. But allow a 
small piece to stick out and allow them to nibble on it. That'll keep him 
interested. Once he completes the trick then you give it to them. Never 
before. Hope i helped!! - Dog trainer for the humane society for 6 years. 
Dog trainer for 8. ;)
comments.author: bellaxedward132

comments.text:
@hanniel04 Don't go to high with your hand, keep the treat in your fist and 
next to his/her lips but allow him/her to smell and nibble at it. But never 
give it to them (Baiting). Keep her/ him baited once he/she does the trick 
that's when you give him/her the treat. Hope i helped!! - Dog trainer for 
the humane society for 6 years. Dog trainer for 8. ;)
comments.author: bellaxedward132
bellaxedward132

comments.text:
@SuckAFatOne007 It depends on the dog. If it's a intense dog, go for it!! 
If it was hard for the dog to understand this trick, go easy on them. And 
for any dog keep sessions varied and allow the dog plenty of time to play 
and learn!! :) - Dog trainer for the humane society for 6 years. Dog 
trainer for 8. ;)
comments.author: bellaxedward132
